TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit OpenWriteCompletedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class are passed to <xref:System.Net.OpenWriteCompletedEventHandler> methods.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates opening a stream to write data to be uploaded.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#16](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the stream is available.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_2.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.openwriteco_1_2.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a writable stream that is used to send data to a server.
Docs.value: A where you can write data to be uploaded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should check the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Error%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Cancelled%2A> properties before using the stream returned by this property. If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Error%2A> property's value is an <xref:System.Exception> object or the <xref:System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs.Cancelled%2A> property's value is `true`, the asynchronous operation did not complete correctly and the Result property's value will not be valid.
## Examples The following code example uses the stream returned by this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.openwriteco_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.openwriteco_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#15](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.net.openwriteco_1.vb)]
